About Pflugerville City Government
==================================

Overview
--------

The City of Pflugerville, Texas was incorporated in 1965 and adopted a [Home Rule Charter](https://ecode360.com/PF6442) form of government in November, 1993.

The provisions in the charter set forth were:

* To provide for the future progress of the city.
* Establish and maintain a system of self-government based on sound fiscal and operational methods.
* Ensure equal protection and treatment of all persons.
* Secure fully the benefits of our location and environment.

City Government Structure
-------------------------

### City Council & Mayor

The City Council and Mayor are the elected officials responsible for guiding the vision and purpose of the City of Pflugerville. Councilmembers operate on an at-large basis, and with the Mayor they give guidance to City Leadership on key decision-making and action planning.

* Visit the [City Council and Mayor page](https://www.pflugervilletx.gov/178/City-Council-Mayor)

### City Manager's Office

The City Manager, Deputy City Manager, Assistant City Managers, and Director of Management Services are responsible for the day-to-day operations and leadership of the City. They work to bring solutions to the City Council and Mayor, as well as work with wider City Leadership on enacting the Council's guidance.

* Visit the [City Manager's Office page](https://www.pflugervilletx.gov/180/City-Manager)

### City Secretary's Office

Appointed by the City Manager, the City Secretary acts as the compliance authority for local, state and federal statutes. The City Secretary's Office administers all city elections; is the custodian of Municipal records (including Council Minutes, resolutions, ordinances, contracts, campaign finance reports and other documents vital to the history of the City), and coordinates board and commission appointments.

* Visit the [City Secretary's Office page](https://www.pflugervilletx.gov/228/City-Secretary)

### Boards & Commissions

While the City Council and Mayor are the governing body of the municipality, several boards, commissions, and committees have been appointed by the City Council to carry out the goals and directives of the citizens and the council. The City of Pflugerville encourages citizens to express their thoughts, volunteer their time and talents, and to actively participate in their local government.

* Visit the [Boards and Commissions page](https://www.pflugervilletx.gov/152/Boards-Committees)

### Home Rule Charter

The Home Rule Charter provides for a City Council/Manager form of government, consisting of a Mayor and Council members, elected by the people and responsible to the people.

The City Manager is appointed by and responsible to the Council for proper administration of the city. The elected Mayor and Council members are subject only to the limitations imposed by the state constitution, applicable state statutes, and the city's home rule charter. All powers of the city lie in the elected Mayor and Council members, who have the responsibilities to institute local legislation, adopt budgets, and determine policies.

The power of the city government is exercised as prescribed by the city's home rule charter or, if not addressed in the charter, as set out by the Code of Ordinances adopted according to the charter's policies and guidelines.

* View theÂ [Home Rule Charter](https://ecode360.com/PF6442)

Additional Information
----------------------

### City Council & Strategic Plan

* Mission: Pflugerville fosters high quality of life, economic opportunity and a sustainable and diverse community.
* Vision: Our vision is to be a dynamic, regional leader by offering a safe, welcoming and inclusive city with a strong sense of community that attracts a talented workforce and desirable businesses.

The City Council's current Strategic Plan is the guiding document that outlines goals and objectives for the City.

* [Strategic Action Plan 2026-2030](https://www.pflugervilletx.gov/asset/cf1191e6-ee4a-4651-9178-2eacb675425b)
* [Strategic Plan 2021-2025](https://content.civicplus.com/api/assets/a9f7b605-2439-42b9-a611-1ffb11e3fb5e)
* [Report on the 2021-2025 Plan](https://content.civicplus.com/api/assets/0481ec22-4b4f-463b-86e1-327c91eac643)

### Texas Municipal League

The city of Pflugerville is a member of the Texas Municipal League, an organization of more than 16,000 city government employees and elected officials. The league is voluntary and open to any city in Texas and provides advocacy, legal support, training and resources. The City of Pflugerville supports the [Our Home, Our Decisions campaign](https://www.tml.org/366/Our-Home-Our-Decisions) that aims to raise awareness about the State of Texas eroding the ability of Texans to have a voice in developing local solutions to local problems that affect their neighborhoods and their communities. Texas is a big state and decisions at the Capitol that affect local cities are not one size fits all. What works in Pflugerville may not work for residents in another city. The Council agreed that it is important to educate residents on the issues taking place at the State Capitol that affect Pflugerville and other cities. For more information [visit the Texas Municipal League website](http://Texas Municipal League).

---------

Information regarding the [City Charter](https://ecode360.com/PF6442) or [Code of Ordinances](https://ecode360.com/PF6442) may be directed to the City Secretary's Office.
